author: Rich Schapiro
description: Ghislaine Maxwell will get to enjoy a number of perks at the cushy prison camp she was transferred to last week, but training service dogs won’t be one of them.
title: Ghislaine Maxwell barred from service dog training at cushy prison camp

author: Tim Stelloh
description: Charges against a Georgia man accused of trying to kidnap a toddler at an Atlanta-area Walmart were dismissed Wednesday after prosecutors said they were “satisfied that the ends of justice have been met.”A motion filed earlier said prosecutors were moving to drop the charges after meeting with the child's mother and reviewing the facts and circumstances surrounding the case
title: Charges dropped against Georgia man accused of trying to kidnap a toddler at Walmart

author: Gabe Joselow
description: A pair of American volunteer doctors described to NBC News a barely coping hospital in Gaza, with bodies spread across the blood-smeared floors as medical staff struggled to treat hundreds of people who had been injured as they tried to access humanitarian aid.“We have children who are dead on the floor and we are unable to move these patients just due to the sheer volume that we received,” Ahmed Farhat, an emergency physician from California, told NBC News in a video message Tuesday, talkin
title: American doctors describe dire conditions at a Khan Younis hospital in Gaza

author: Phil Helsel
description: The Army soldier accused of shooting five other service members at Fort Stewart, Georgia, on Wednesday is a 28-year-old who has been assigned to the Georgia base for around three years, officials said.Sgt.
title: Who is Quornelius Radford? What we know about the Fort Stewart shooting suspect

author: Aria Bendix
description: Craving French fries? Dunking your spuds in a deep fryer might be a recipe for elevating your risk of type 2 diabetes.
title: A salty twist: Diabetes risk study says french fries are a culprit

author: Dylan Ebs
description: Texas Republicans' move to redraw their congressional map mid-decade and Democrats' retaliatory redistricting efforts have captured national attention for a very simple reason: How House districts are drawn can shape American politics for years
title: Why redistricting is so important, in 3 charts

author: The Politics Desk
description: Welcome to the online version of From the Politics Desk, an evening newsletter that brings you the NBC News Politics team’s latest reporting and analysis from the White House, Capitol Hill and the campaign trail
title: Is the next JD Vance in Kentucky?: From the Politics Desk

author: Berkeley Lovelace Jr.
description: In January, Dr. Elisabeth Potter said she was midway through performing a breast reconstruction surgery when a call from a representative from UnitedHealthcare came into the operating room.
title: Texas surgeon says UnitedHealthcare dispute may force her into bankruptcy

author: Marlene Lenthang
description: The suspect accused of fatally shooting four people at a Montana bar and who remains at large struggled with mental health issues, but was denied services from agencies that were supposed to help, according to his niece
title: Niece says Montana bar shooting suspect was turned away from mental health treatment

author: Steve Kopack
description: Apple said that it would expand its planned investment in the United States as it faces pressure from President Donald Trump to shift its supply chain.
title: Apple, under pressure from Trump, says it's boosting U.S. investment

author: Kimmy Yam
description: Stanford University’s student newspaper sued the Trump administration Wednesday over two provisions in federal immigration law that it says the officials have wielded against those with pro-Palestinian views
title: Stanford student newspaper sues Trump officials over immigration law that they say led to chilling of free speech

author: Erik Ortiz
description: The federal prison camp in central Texas where Ghislaine Maxwell was transferred to last week has increased security measures in response to her arrival, according to a senior law enforcement official
title: Texas prison camp where Ghislaine Maxwell was moved steps up security

description: After a soldier allegedly opened fire on his own unit at Fort Stewart, fellow soldiers subdued and detained him until authorities arrived, highlighting both the rapid response by troops and ongoing concerns over base security.
title: Fort Stewart shooting raises questions about base security and response protocols

description: Officials identified the Fort Stewart shooting suspect as Quornelius Radford, an active duty soldier. Brig. Gen. John Lubas, commander of the 3rd Infantry Division and Fort Stewart-Hunter Army Airfield, said the five soldiers injured in the incident will make a full recovery.
title: Fort Stewart shooting suspect identified as active duty soldier Quornelius Radford

author: Tim Stelloh
description: A suspect opened fire at an Army base in Georgia on Wednesday, injuring at least five soldiers in an incident military officials described as an “active” shooting
title: What we know about the Army base shooting at Fort Stewart in Georgia

author: Marina E. Franco
description: Chronic absenteeism impacts children's health and outcomes and affects classmates and school resources, experts say, as some districts try to stem families' fears of going to school.
title: Immigration raid fears trigger Latino student absences, as experts warn of consequences

author: Henry J. Gomez
description: Nate Morris, who is aiming to succeed Mitch McConnell, is running with a family story and anti-establishment pitch similar to the one JD Vance eventually rode to the vice presidency.
title: Meet the Republican Senate candidate in Kentucky who could be the next JD Vance

description: Watch live coverage as President Trump holds a White House event for Apple’s commitment to a new investment in American manufacturing. Apple CEO Tim Cook is expected to join the president for the announcement.
title: Trump holds White House event on Apple investment in U.S. manufacturing

author: Daniella Silva
description: Immigrants seeking green cards through marriage could be vulnerable to deportation, according to a new Trump administration policy
title: Immigrants seeking green cards may be placed in removal proceedings, USCIS says

author: Linda Carroll
description: People whose homes are near busy highways may be able to reduce their blood pressure by running an air purifier with a HEPA filter, a study found
title: This type of air filter can help lower blood pressure, study finds

description: Five people were shot at Georgia's Fort Stewart-Hunter Army Airfield. The victims were taken to a nearby hospital and the suspected shooter is in custody.
title: Special Report: Five soldiers shot in Fort Stewart shooting

description: A shooter was taken into custody, according to a statement from the army base.
title: At least five soldiers are shot on Fort Stewart base in Georgia

author: Natasha Korecki
description: Democratic state legislators from Texas were evacuated from their suburban Chicago hotel Wednesday morning following a threat at the property, and a news conference set to feature Democratic Sen.
title: Texas state lawmakers in Illinois evacuated from their hotel after threat

author: Marlene Lenthang
description: A Florida judge may decide on Wednesday whether to halt operations at "Alligator Alcatraz," a migrant detention facility in the Florida Everglades, due to environmental concerns
title: Judge hears evidence about environmental concerns around Alligator Alcatraz

author: Minyvonne Burke
description: The woman found dead on a docked boat at a ritzy Hamptons yacht club has been identified as 33-year-old local designer Martha Nolan-O’Slatarra.
title: New York designer found dead on boat at Montauk Yacht Club

description: A former Florida corrections worker who spent time working at the immigrant detention center known as "Alligator Alcatraz" says detainees are being subjected to unsanitary and dangerous conditions. WTVJ's Hatzel Vela reports.
title: 'It's inhumane': Former 'Alligator Alcatraz' worker describes conditions

author: Hatzel Vela, NBC South Florida
description: In an exclusive report, NBC6 spoke with a former corrections officer who says she saw hundreds held in cages with no sunlight, backed up toilets and little access to showers.
title: Former 'Alligator Alcatraz' worker describes 'inhumane' conditions inside

author: Steve Kopack
description: President Donald Trump said he was doubling tariffs on India from 25% to 50%.
title: Trump hikes India tariffs to 50% for buying Russian oil

author: Jackson Peck
description: An American hiker who hadn't been heard from for six days during a solo backpacking trip on a glacier in Norway has been found, the local Red Cross said on Wednesday
title: American hiker who went missing on Norwegian glacier rescued

author: David K. Li
description: Another sex toy was hurled from the stands toward WNBA players, this time during the Fever-Sparks game and landing near Fever guard Sophie Cunningham.
title: Sex toy thrown on court during Fever-Sparks game in L.A., third such WNBA incident in a week

author: Ben Kamisar
description: Sen. Marsha Blackburn, R-Tenn., is running for governor, she announced Wednesday, promising to help her state be "America’s conservative leader" for generations to come.
title: Sen. Marsha Blackburn announces she's running for governor in Tennessee

author: Marlene Lenthang
description: Actor Kelley Mack, best known for playing Addy on "The Walking Dead," died over the weekend, her family announced
title: Walking Dead actress Kelley Mack dies at 33

description: Steve Witkoff’s visit comes after Trump expressed frustration with Putin and threatened severe economic penalties if peace deal is not reached.
title: Trump's envoy meets Putin ahead of Russia-Ukraine peace deadline

description: Donald Trump's foreign envoy Steve Witcoff is meeting with Russian President Vladimir Putin for last-minute talks ahead of Trump’s Friday deadline to impose punishing new sanctions on Russia if the country does not agree to an immediate ceasefire in Ukraine. Witcoff has met with Putin four times with little to show for his efforts and Putin is stubbornly signaling he will not back down. NBC’s Keir Simmons reports for TODAY.
title: US Envoy Meets With Putin Ahead of Trump's Sanctions Deadline

description: NBC News has learned the Trump administration is considering publicly releasing transcripts of Ghislaine Maxwell’s two-day interview with the Department of Justice, according to a source familiar with the matter. It comes as the president is denying he played any role in the transfer of Maxwell from a Florida prison to a minimum security federal prison camp in Texas that typically does not hold sex offenders. NBC’s Gabe Gutierrez reports for TODAY.
title: Trump Denies Playing Role in Transfer of Ghislaine Maxwell

author: Kayla Hayempour
description: Gavin Newsom and Kathy Hochul to counter GOP redistricting in Texas. Ghislaine Maxwell's prison transfer. RFK Jr. vaccine research cuts. Hiroshima anniversary.
title: The Democratic governors countering Texas redistricting and federal cuts to vaccine research: Morning Rundown

author: The Associated Press
description: LONDON — British regulators criticized on Wednesday both sides in a dispute over the future of a charity founded by Prince Harry and Prince Seeiso of Lesotho, for allowing the issue to be played out in public and damaging the organization’s reputation
title: Prince Harry among those criticized in spat over charity he cofounded

author: The Associated Press
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin held talks with U.S.
title: Trump's envoy meets Putin ahead of Russia-Ukraine peace deadline

author: Harriet Baskas
description: Airports everywhere are undergoing makeovers, amplifying VIP-style services and other amenities that offer travelers expanded options for their journey.
title: Airports are raising their VIP game with billion-dollar upgrades and swanky lounges

author: Sahil Kapur
description: Democrats in America's two biggest blue states are hatching plans to respond in kind to a mid-decade move by Texas to draw a friendlier House map for Republicans
title: Democrats draw up plans to retaliate if Republicans gerrymander Texas — but they face legal hurdles

author: Daniela Pierre-Bravo
description: In a Trump-supporting Ohio county, Haitian immigrant Marc Rocher, a church volunteer, teacher and helper to a family with adopted Haitian children, is challenging some to grapple with hard-line immigration views.
title: He fled Haiti and became integral to a conservative community. Now they’re fighting his deportation.

author: Allan Smith
description: Doug Mastriano is teasing another bid for governor in Pennsylvania.
title: Josh Shapiro is getting presidential buzz, but a battleground re-election campaign beckons first

author: Rudy Chinchilla
description: The man suspected of shooting dead four people midtown Manhattan last month had years earlier threatened to kill himself as he dealt with depression and concussion symptoms, according to a phone call his mother made to police.
title: Midtown Manhattan shooter was treated for sports-related concussions, mother said in 2022 police call

author: Janis Mackey Frayer
description: HIROSHIMA, Japan — For more than half a century, chimes have rung out across the Japanese city of Hiroshima every morning at exactly 8:15
title: 80 years later, Hiroshima bombing survivors warn of new nuclear warfare

author: Peter Alexander
description: The Trump administration is considering publicly releasing the transcript of a Justice Department official's two-day interview with Ghislaine Maxwell last month, a source familiar with the matter told NBC News on Tuesday.“We’re leaning toward transparency,” the source said
title: Trump administration considering releasing transcript of DOJ's interview with Ghislaine Maxwell

author: Raquel Coronell Uribe
description: Edward Coristine, the Trump administration employee nicknamed "Big Balls," was the victim of a carjacking and assault in Washington over the weekend, police said.
title: Trump threatens federal control of D.C. following attack on administration staffer known as 'Big Balls'

author: The Associated Press
description: BRUSSELS — NATO has started coordinating regular deliveries of large weapons packages to Ukraine.
title: NATO to coordinate regular and large-scale arms deliveries to Ukraine. Most will be bought in the U.S.

author: Tim Stelloh
description: The man who confessed to fatally stabbing four University of Idaho students nearly three years ago was investigated in connection with an earlier break-in that involved a knife-wielding intruder wearing a ski mask, records show
title: Bryan Kohberger was investigated in a break-in involving a masked intruder in Washington

author: Aria Bendix
description: The Trump administration is terminating 22 contracts focused on developing mRNA vaccines and winding down additional federal investments in mRNA technology, Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr.
title: RFK Jr. cuts $500 million in mRNA vaccine contracts

author: Zoë Richards
description: The lawsuit filed with the Texas Supreme Court argues that Rep. Gene Wu violated the state Constitution and that his absence amounted to an abandonment of office.
title: Texas Gov. Greg Abbott sues to remove state House Democratic Caucus chair in redistricting standoff
